Question: After a few months in Marshalsea, John ****'s paternal grandmother, John ****, died and bequeathed him the sum of £450.
Hints: The question as to whether this person belongs to the tradition of the sentimental novel is debatable.
As a child, this person had walked past the house and dreamed of living in it.
Prone to living beyond his means, John **** was imprisoned in the Marshalsea debtors' prison in Southwark London in 1824.
